138.title: Conference closing and contest winners
138.description: Don't miss the closing ceremony, all gifts from our sponsors and partners will find their owners during this session.

137.title: Afterparty & Networking
137.description: The afterparty is a great time to have some fun and solidify your new friendships

136.title: GDG DevFest Sudbury 2016 Opening
136.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the organizers, sponsors and partners.

134.title: Lightning talks
134.description: Short (5 or 10 minute) energetic talks on cool development technology

132.title: Registration & morning Coffee
132.description: Get your badge, coffee, enjoy talking with fellow developer enthusiasts!

131.title: Build a Progressive Web App with Firebase, Polymerfire and Polymer Components
131.description: In this codelab, you'll learn how to make a progressive web app using Firebase and Polymer Web Components. You'll connect pre-made view components to Firebase data components to build an app that features user authentication, a database backend, offline data availability and the ability to be installed to the home screen of an Android device.

130.title: Accelerated Mobile Pages Foundations
130.description: In this codelab, you'll learn how to build Accelerated Mobile Pages -- or AMP for short. To achieve this you will implement a simple news article web page that conforms to the AMP specifications while incorporating several typical web features commonly used on mobile news sites.

129.title: Janitor: the fastest development system in the world
129.description: The effort required to set up complex development environments can reduce contributions. Janitor uses container technology to deliver a complete development environment so that contributors can focus on fixing bugs and adding features.

128.title: Backing up an AngularJS front end with an ASP.net backend
128.description: ASP.net can provide a great backend for AngularJS; in this talk, learn how MVC without the V can give you an MVP outcome.

102.title: From AngularJS to Angular 2
102.description: With the release of Angular 2.0 in September, our curiosity turns to the process of migrating from AngularJS to Angular 2.0. Trevor will report on his experiments following the recommended upgrade paths.

101.title: Building virtual reality games with Unity and Google Cardboard
101.description: With the release of Daydream VR, virtual reality games have taken another leap forward. Zack has been building games with Unity and the Cardboard SDK this year, and will share his experiences.
